definition: pathogenic influence (TCM)
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
old variant of 邪[xie2]
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal
noxious winds, evil influences (idiom); malignant social trends

sentences.english: The iniquities of the unions are her pet peeve at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 此时协会中的歪风邪气是令她最气恼的事。

sentences.english: Therefore it was important to emphasize the role of wind-evil in the pathogenesis of palmus in the syndrome differentiation.
sentences.chinese: 在辨证论治的前提下，重视风邪为患在发病中的作用。

sentences.english: This shows that as soon as we slacken our efforts, evil trends will crop up.
sentences.chinese: 这说明，一旦搞得不好，歪风邪气就会。

sentences.english: At that moment the risk of contagion would be at its greatest.
sentences.chinese: 到那个时候，这种歪风邪气的风险将会上升到最大值。

sentences.english: We must eradicate the unhealthy tendency of cheating in exams.
sentences.chinese: 我们一定要杜绝考试作弊的歪风邪气。

definition: (TCM) six excesses causing illness, namely: excessive wind 風|风[feng1], cold 寒[han2], heat 暑[shu3], damp 濕|湿[shi1], dryness 燥[zao4], fire 火[huo3]
wind chill/cold weather/common cold (medicine)
pathogeny (cause of disease) in TCM/as opposed to vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4]
affected by cold/to catch cold
old variant of 邪[xie2]
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal
superficial syndrome/illness that has not attacked the vital organs of the human body
one of the channels of TCM
(TCM) six unhealthy influences causing illness, namely: excessive wind 風|风[feng1], cold 寒[han2], heat 暑[shu3], damp 濕|湿[shi1], dryness 燥[zao4], fire 火[huo3]
localized pain disorder (in Chinese medicine)/arthralgia syndrome/bi disorder
evil influence/unhealthy trend/(a person's) evil air/aura of wickedness/(TCM) pathogenic energy (opposite: 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4], vital energy)
(in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
half outside, half inside/half interior, half exterior
stagnation of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
paralysis/numbness
energy channels/meridian (TCM)/(dialect) trick/tactic
inner organs
